dataObjects.bibliographicCitation: Kazembe, J., Makocho, P. & Mailosi, A. 2006. Copadichromis azureus. In: IUCN 2014 . IUCN Red List of Threatened Species. Version 2014.1 . <www.iucnredlist.org>
dataObjects.description: Endemic to Lake Malawi. Occurs in the southern part of the lake. Observed at Mbenje island, Nkhomo reef, Eccles reef and around the Malere islands.

dataObjects.subject: http://rs.tdwg.org/ontology/voc/SPMInfoItems#Habitat
dataObjects.title: Habitat and Ecology
dataObjects.rights: © International Union for Conservation of Nature and Natural Resources
dataObjects.rightsHolder: International Union for Conservation of Nature and Natural Resources
dataObjects.bibliographicCitation: Kazembe, J., Makocho, P. & Mailosi, A. 2006. Copadichromis azureus. In: IUCN 2014 . IUCN Red List of Threatened Species. Version 2014.1 . <www.iucnredlist.org>
dataObjects.description:
Habitat and Ecology
This species prefers sandy parts of intermediate habitats. Occurs at depth below 10 m. Females and non-breeding males gather in small foraging groups while feeding on plankton. Males have been seen feeding on detritus on the bottom. Breeding occurs throughout the year and slows during the rainy season. Males build caves in the intermediate habitat at levels deeper than 17 m. Very popular among aquarists. Aquarium trade name – Haplochromis crysonotus.

Systems
  • Freshwater

dataObjects.title: Copadichromis azureus
dataObjects.bibliographicCitation: "Copadichromis azureus." Wikipedia, The Free Encyclopedia. 3 Oct 2013, 02:59 UTC. 1 Sep 2014 <http://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Copadichromis_azureus&oldid=623390128>.
dataObjects.description:
Copadichromis azureus is a species of fish in the Cichlidae family. It is endemic to Malawi.
